title: How do scientists monitor water quality? - Quora

response.answer_text: It’s awfully hard because quality can be different at every faucet. But they test the supply regularly by running a bottle full down at the plant and testing that bottle. The hard part of the test is that they have to record every hand that held the bottle.
Highly technical systems can be put in place to monitor water quality. For example, Metasphere can use a range of sensors in their installations.
